name: Mr. Jason PARKER, Petitioner v. Municipal Court Judge Rayford A. MEANS, Respondent

pin_cites.parenthetical: providing that hybrid representation is not permitted
providing that hybrid representation is not permitted

parties: Mr. Jason PARKER, Petitioner v. Municipal Court Judge Rayford A. MEANS, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 20th day of April, 2016, the Application for Leave to File Original Process, the Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus, and the Application for an Immediate Hearing are DISMISSED. See Commonwealth v. Reid, 537 Pa. 167, 642 A.2d 453 (1994) (providing that hybrid representation is not permitted).
The Prothonotary is DIRECTED to forward the filings to counsel of record and to strike the name of the jurist from the caption.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
135 A.3d 176
Mr. Jason PARKER, Petitioner v. Municipal Court Judge Rayford A. MEANS, Respondent.
No. 32 EM 2016.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
April 20, 2016.
